foundation_papers.title: The Queer Safety Index: A Comprehensive Framework for Measuring LGBTQ+ Safety Globally
foundation_papers.author: Levi Hankins
foundation_papers.research_question: How can we develop a scientifically rigorous, intersectional framework for measuring LGBTQ+ safety across diverse global contexts?
foundation_papers.methodology: Mixed-methods approach combining quantitative safety indicators, qualitative community feedback, and machine learning analysis of 161 cities across 66 countries
key_contributions: Novel QSI methodology with intersectional analysis
Comprehensive global dataset of LGBTQ+ safety indicators
Validated measurement framework for policy applications
Open-source tools for researchers and organizations
foundation_papers.expected_impact: Establish global standard for LGBTQ+ safety measurement

foundation_papers.title: Intersectional Analysis of LGBTQ+ Safety: Race, Gender, and Geographic Disparities in Global Context
foundation_papers.author: Levi Hankins
foundation_papers.research_question: How do intersecting identities of race, gender, sexuality, and geographic location affect LGBTQ+ safety outcomes globally?
foundation_papers.methodology: Longitudinal intersectional analysis using QSI data across 161 cities with demographic stratification and machine learning clustering
key_contributions: First global intersectional analysis of LGBTQ+ safety
Geographic mapping of intersectional safety risks
foundation_papers.expected_impact: Reshape understanding of LGBTQ+ safety through intersectional lens

foundation_papers.title: AI-Powered Predictive Modeling for LGBTQ+ Safety Risk Assessment and Early Warning Systems
foundation_papers.author: Levi Hankins
foundation_papers.research_question: Can machine learning models accurately predict LGBTQ+ safety risks and inform proactive interventions?
foundation_papers.methodology: Deep learning analysis of safety indicators with predictive modeling, validation across multiple datasets, and real-time monitoring system development
key_contributions: Novel AI architecture for safety risk prediction
Real-time early warning system for LGBTQ+ communities
Open-source AI tools for safety organizations
foundation_papers.expected_impact: Enable proactive safety interventions through AI prediction

foundation_papers.title: Policy Impact Assessment: How QSI Data Drives Legislative Change and Improves LGBTQ+ Rights Globally
foundation_papers.author: Levi Hankins
foundation_papers.research_question: What is the relationship between QSI publication and subsequent policy changes affecting LGBTQ+ rights and safety?
foundation_papers.methodology: Policy analysis and causal inference examining legislative changes following QSI data release across 66 countries with difference-in-differences analysis
key_contributions: First causal analysis of data-driven policy change
Quantified impact of research on legislative outcomes
foundation_papers.expected_impact: Demonstrate research impact on real-world policy outcomes
